item.title: 美国油田公司大幅降价，因为巨型兼并导致客户群缩小
item.description: 石油生产商之间的巨型兼并浪潮迫使美国钻井和水力压裂服务公司在争夺日益减少的客户数量时不得不降价、合并，或冒着破产的风险。【原文：A wave of mega-mergers among oil producers is forcing the U.S. service companies that drill and hydraulically fracture wells to slash their prices, merge, or risk bankruptcy as they compete for a dwindling number of customers.】

item.title: 加拿大央行再次降息
item.description: 加拿大央行周三连续第二个月将其关键政策利率下调了25个基点，使其降至4.5%，并表示如果通胀继续按照预测降温，可能会进一步下调。【原文：The Bank of Canada on Wednesday trimmed its key policy rate by 25 basis points for the second month in row, bringing it down to 4.5%, and said more cuts were likely if inflation continued to cool in line with forecasts.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局与工会就新的空中交通管制员休息规则达成一致
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局周三表示，它已与一个雇员工会达成协议，以确保空中交通管制员获得额外的休息时间。【原文：The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration said on Wednesday it had struck a deal with an employee union to ensure that air-traffic controllers receive additional rest.】

item.title: 谷歌的 Vertex AI 将使用 Mistral AI 的 Codestral
item.description: 谷歌云（Google Cloud）周三表示，谷歌的顶点人工智能（Vertex AI）服务将使用 Mistral AI 的 Codestral 人工智能模型。【原文：Google Cloud will use Mistral AI's Codestral artificial intelligence model for Google's Vertex AI service, Google Cloud said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 冷冻食品供应商兰姆-韦斯顿（Lamb Weston）因需求疲软而发布黯淡的年度预测
item.description: 由于冷冻食品价格上涨开始影响销量，兰姆-韦斯顿公司周三预测其年度销售额和利润将低于分析师预期，导致其股价在早盘交易中暴跌超过 20%。【原文：Lamb Weston forecast its annual sales and profit below analysts' expectations on Wednesday, as higher prices of its frozen food products begin to hurt volumes, sending its shares plunging more than 20% in early trading.】

item.title: 欧元区银行投资银行业务受到提振，但前景令股价停滞不前
item.description: 欧元区最大的银行周三的第二季度盈利基本超出预期，受益于仍然较高的利率和丰厚的投资银行业务，尽管对更严峻前景的担忧抑制了这些银行的股价。【原文：The euro zone's biggest banks largely beat second quarter earnings expectations on Wednesday, benefiting from still-high interest rates and bumper investment banking business, although concerns about a tougher outlook held back their shares.】

item.title: 华特迪士尼与工会达成临时协议，避免迪士尼乐园停工
item.description: 代表迪斯尼乐园 1.4 万名员工的工会周三表示，他们已与沃尔特-迪斯尼公司达成临时劳资协议，避免了主题公园停工事件的发生。【原文：Unions representing 14,000 Disneyland employees said on Wednesday they had reached a tentative labor agreement with Walt Disney , averting a work stoppage at the theme park.】

item.title: 美国商业活动走高；定价能力减弱
item.description: 7 月份，美国商业活动攀升至 27 个月以来的新高，但在消费者的抵制下，企业似乎难以维持较高的商品和服务价格，这进一步刺激了通胀前景。【原文：U.S. business activity climbed to a 27-month high in July, but firms appeared to have some difficulty sustaining higher prices for their goods and services amid resistance from consumers, offering a further boost to the inflation outlook.】

item.title: 加拿大央行下调 2024 年经济增长预期，认为通胀将在 2025 年下半年达到目标
item.description: 路透社渥太华7月24日电）加拿大央行周三以消费下降为由下调了2024年的经济增长预期，并重申预计通胀率将在2025年下半年可持续地恢复到2%的目标。【原文：OTTAWA, July 24 (Reuters) - The Bank of Canada on Wednesday trimmed its growth forecast for 2024, citing lower consumption, and reiterated that it expected inflation to return sustainably to its 2% target in the second half of 2025.】

item.title: 连锁影院 AMC 预计第二季度亏损，原因是大片上映减少
item.description: AMC Entertainment 周三表示，预计第二季度将亏损 3280 万美元，而去年同期则盈利 860 万美元，亏损原因是去年好莱坞双罢工导致电影上映推迟。【原文：AMC Entertainment said on Wednesday it expects to report a loss of $32.8 million for the second quarter, compared to a profit of $8.6 million a year earlier, citing impact from last year's dual Hollywood strikes that delayed movie releases.】

item.title: 唐纳德-特朗普就任总统将有利于国防开支，HEICO 公司高管如是说
item.description: 独立航空航天和国防零部件生产商海科公司（Heico Corp）联合总裁埃里克-门德尔森（Eric Mendelson）周三告诉路透社记者，唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）担任总统将有利于美国国防工业。【原文：A Donald Trump presidency would benefit the U.S. defense industry, independent aerospace and defense parts producer Heico Corp's co-president Eric Mendelson told Reuters on Wednesday.】

item.title: Anglo to face investors with wary eye on BHP's potential return
item.description: Anglo American investors will keenly scrutinize CEO Duncan Wanblad on Thursday as he gives an update on the London-based miner's strategy, just months after fighting off a $49 billion takeover bid from bigger rival BHP Group .

item.title: Japan plans record hike in minimum wage, NHK reports
item.description: A panel at the Japanese labour ministry has decided to raise the national average minimum wage by about 5% to 1,054 yen ($6.85) per hour this fiscal year, the biggest ever jump, public broadcaster NHK reported on Wednesday.

item.title: 美国 6 月商品贸易逆差收窄
item.description: 由于出口反弹，美国 6 月份的货物贸易逆差有所收窄，但贸易可能仍会拖累第二季度的经济增长。【原文：The U.S. trade deficit in goods narrowed in June as exports rebounded, but trade likely remained a drag on economic growth in the second quarter.】

item.title: Statscan初步估计：加拿大6月工厂销售额很可能下降2.6
item.description: 加拿大统计局（Statistics Canada）周三在一份速报估计中称，加拿大 6 月份的工厂销售额很可能比 5 月份下降 2.6%，这主要是由于化学产品和运输设备分行业的影响。【原文：Canadian factory sales most likely fell 2.6% in June from May, largely due to the chemical product and transportation equipment subsectors, Statistics Canada said in a flash estimate on Wednesday.】

item.title: 公用事业公司 NextEra 第二季度利润和收入不及预期
item.description: NextEra Energy 公司第二季度利润未达预期，主要受利率上升和可再生能源部门支出增加的影响。【原文：NextEra Energy missed profit estimates for the second quarter, hurt by higher interest rates and expenses in its renewables segment.】

item.title: 红杉资本支持的 Vanta 以 24.5 亿美元估值融资
item.description: 在线安全与合规管理平台 Vanta 周三表示，该公司在风险投资公司红杉资本（Sequoia Capital）领投的新一轮融资中筹集了 1.5 亿美元，估值达 24.5 亿美元。【原文：Online security and compliance management platform Vanta said on Wednesday it had raised $150 million in a fresh funding round led by venture capital firm Sequoia Capital, giving it a valuation of $2.45 billion.】

item.title: 微软希望通过与 Lumen Technologies 合作提升人工智能工作负载能力
item.description: 微软（Microsoft）和路明科技（Lumen Technologies）周三表示，微软将使用路明科技的网络设备来扩大其人工智能工作负载的容量，因为这家科技巨头希望满足其数据中心日益增长的需求。【原文：Microsoft will use Lumen Technologies' network equipment to expand its capacity for AI workloads, the companies said on Wednesday, as the technology giant looks to meet growing demand at its data centers.】

item.title: 中国和美国建筑活动放缓，奥的斯下调年度销售预期
item.description: 电梯制造商奥的斯全球公司周三下调了 2024 年净销售额预期，原因是北美和中国对其新设备的需求疲软。【原文：Elevator maker Otis Worldwide lowered its 2024 net sales forecast on Wednesday on softening demand for its new equipment from North America and China.】

item.title: 交易量创历史新高，交易所运营商 CME 盈利超预期
item.description: 芝加哥商品交易所集团（CME Group）周三公布的第二季度利润高于华尔街预期，原因是市场的不确定性帮助该交易所运营商创下了创纪录的交易量。【原文：CME Group reported its second-quarter profit above Wall Street estimates on Wednesday as uncertainty in markets helped the exchange operator notch record trading volumes.】

item.title: Visa 收入不佳引发华尔街警惕
item.description: Visa 第三季度营收不尽如人意，促使多家券商下调了该公司股票的目标价，加剧了人们对客户支出增长放缓的担忧，给美国支付行业蒙上了一层阴影。【原文：Visa's underwhelming third-quarter revenue prompted a number of brokerages to cut their price targets on the company's stock, stoking concerns about slowing growth in customer spending and casting a shadow on the U.S. payments industry.】

item.title: Facebook 因 "sextortion "诈骗在尼日利亚删除 63,000 个账户
item.description: Meta Platforms 周三表示，它已删除了尼日利亚约 6.3 万个 Facebook 账户，这些账户试图进行金融性勒索诈骗，主要针对美国的成年男性。【原文：Meta Platforms said on Wednesday it had removed about 63,000 Facebook accounts in Nigeria that attempted to engage in financial sexual extortion scams mostly aimed at adult men in the United States.】

item.title: 消息人士称，美洲开发银行和巴西公共银行将推出亚马逊 ETF
item.description: 两位知情人士透露，美洲开发银行（IDB）和巴西的公共银行将于本周四宣布开发一只交易所交易基金（ETF），该基金将专注于亚马逊雨林的可持续投资。【原文：The Inter-American Development Bank (IDB) and Brazil's public banks will announce on Thursday the development of an exchange-traded fund (ETF) focused on sustainable investments in the Amazon rainforest, said two people with direct knowledge.】

item.title: 黄金反弹将提高纽蒙特和巴里克矿业公司的利润
item.description: 在贵金属价格上涨的推动下，世界两大黄金矿商纽蒙特公司和巴里克黄金公司预计将公布更高的季度利润。【原文：Newmont Corp and Barrick Gold Corp , the top two gold miners of the world, are expected to post higher quarterly profits, powered by a rally in the precious metal's prices.】

item.title: 生物技术需求出现改善迹象，赛默飞上调利润预期
item.description: 赛默飞（Thermo Fisher）周三上调了其年度利润展望，并公布了好于预期的第二季度利润，这主要得益于临床试验中使用的工具和服务需求的增长。【原文：Thermo Fisher on Wednesday raised its annual profit outlook and posted a better-than-expected second-quarter profit, banking on improved demand for its tools and services used in clinical trials.】

item.title: 防务公司称政治风暴不会抑制军费开支增长
item.description: 防务公司相信，西方政府将继续增加武器开支，以对抗俄罗斯和中国，并消除了对美国和欧洲政治动荡可能抑制军事预算的担忧。【原文：Defence firms are confident Western governments will continue to increase spending on weapons to counter Russia and China, brushing off concerns that political upheaval in the United States and Europe could curb military budgets.】

item.title: 通用动力公司因国防需求增加而实现季度收入增长
item.description: 通用动力公司（General Dynamics）周三报告称，受弹药和核动力潜艇需求增加的影响，公司第二季度收入增长了 18%。【原文：General Dynamics reported an 18% rise in second-quarter revenue on Wednesday, helped by higher demand for its ammunitions and nuclear-powered submarines.】

item.title: 达美航空公司周三航班取消数量大幅下降
item.description: 达美航空公司（Delta Air Lines）周三报告称，取消航班的数量大幅减少，这家美国航空公司自上周五以来取消了6000多个航班，目前正在努力恢复正常。【原文：Delta Air Lines reported sharply fewer cancellations Wednesday as the U.S. airline looks to return to normal after cancelling more than 6,000 flights since Friday.】

item.title: Alphabet 下跌，因支出给季度业绩超预期蒙上阴影
item.description: 谷歌母公司 Alphabet 的股价在周三的盘前交易中下跌超过 3%，此前该公司表示，由于搜索和云计算领域的竞争日趋激烈，导致支出增加。【原文：Alphabet's shares fell more than 3% in premarket trading on Wednesday after the Google-parent flagged higher expenses due to competition heating up in search and cloud computing.】

item.title: 投资者对日本修改后的外汇干预蓝图感到困惑
item.description: 日本官方买入以捍卫日元迅速成为 2024 年外汇市场的一个标准特征，但东京当局已经改变了他们的方法，使投资者更难猜测他们何时以及如何介入。【原文：Japanese official buying to defend the yen is fast becoming a standard feature of the FX landscape in 2024, but authorities in Tokyo have switched up their methods, making it even trickier for investors to second-guess when and how they might step in.】
